Scenario 3

Capt Z was transporting 2000 rounds of .22 ammunition to a biathlon competition. It was a long drive and he decided to stop for gas and a bite to eat. He ate quickly and resumed his trip, arriving in plenty of time. When he went to unload the ammunition, he discovered it had been stolen! Perhaps he had forgotten to lock the car when he stopped? Just then, the biathlon competition staff arrive to take the ammunition to the range.

 

Who could be impacted by this?

Some of the impacts could be:

 

•        The biathlon competition can’t be conducted – resulting in lost wages, lost time and a negative impact to the cadets and staff involved.

•        Capt P could be found negligent in performance of his duties and possibly charged or not hired in the future.

•        The CCO and CAF could receive very negative publicity and that can impact public trust in members to do their jobs professionally.
